results.title: Sets: construction and display
results.creator_credit: Lawrie Lawler and Centre for Educational Television Overseas
results.brief_description: Studies television studio set design, concentrating on three common production situations: - the presenter set’, theinterview set’, and the `drama set’. Includes details of their design, planning and construction. Emphasises the need for co-ordination with studio engineers. Well presented and easy to understand with good use of models as an instructive tool.

results.title: Sets and numbers
results.brief_description: Uses animation to define the mathematical concept of sets and numbers. Introduces the concepts of order, cardinal number, empty set and equivalent set. Explains that consecutive numbers are just one larger than the preceding numeral.
results.description: Uses animation to define the mathematical concept of sets and numbers. Introduces the concepts of order, cardinal number, empty set and equivalent set. Explains that consecutive numbers are just one larger than the preceding numeral.

results.title: Set no limits: Sydney 2000 Paralympic Games
results.brief_description: Australian Paralympians don’t often receive as much publicity as their non paralympic counterparts. This video attempts to even out the balance by providing highlights and victories from previous Paralympic Games, which began in 1960. Highlighted on the video is Lizzie (as in lizard), mascot of the Paralympic Games who symbolises the dreams and motivation of the competitors. This section is narrated by Olivia Newton-John. Suitable for primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Sestrieres 1949
results.creator_credit: Oxford University Film Society and Hugh Wyn Griffith
results.brief_description: This film is a photographic impression of a skiing holiday taken by 300 British students. No text and musical accompaniament acts as a narrative to the images we see. Great footage of skiers and Italian Alps. Music by Christofer Shaw and photography by Michael Warne, Charles Carson.

results.title: Sesame street show No.1. Part one
results.brief_description: Part of the famous television series for children which was evolved after months of research and planning. The series uses a mixture of puppets, film segments and animated cartoons, together with `on set’ live characters, all presented in segments short enough to be within the interest span of pre-school children.

results.title: Serving in silence: the Margarethe Cammermeyer story
results.creator_credit: Richard Heus, Tri-Star Pictures and Jeff Bleckner
results.brief_description: Based on a true story and made for television, this film starring Glenn Close and Judy Davis garnered the film 3 Emmys, including Outstanding Individual Achievement in Writing for a miniseries or Special, in addition to Best Actress (Close) and Supporting Actress (Davis). It tells the story of successful army nurse Margarethe “Grethe” Cammermeye who, after disclosing her sexual orientation, inadvertently closes the door on any avenue for promotion, thus earning her the dubious status of being the highest ever ranking officer dismissed for being a homosexual. Executive producer - Barbra Streisand.

results.title: Serving food
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Army
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Hospital food service personnel training”.
Emphasises principles of food preparation and service in hospitals - proper temperature, correct quality, selection of food to meet patient’s requirements, and courteous attention buy food service personnel.

results.title: Service at sea in the marine police
results.creator_credit: B.H. Hipkins, Malayan Film Unit and D.S. Green
results.brief_description: A Malayan constable volunteers to join Malaya’s Maritime Police. After a period of seamanship training he is posted to a police launch operating in coastal waters. As a member of the crew he takes part in patrols searching for smugglers, gun-runners and other undesirables.
